column1: length and in at middle stump, blocked on the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off, slashes and misses
short of a length at the legs, thuds the thigh guard and trickles to short fine's right
length outside off and rising sharply . Left alone. Great ball but also a no-ball. Front foot a long way out. Free-hit coming up
backs away and drives but straight to mid-on off the inside half. Full and in at middle stump. Couldn't make room to get this away
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short of a length and wide outside off, slashes and misses

bowled him! What a start from Mills! Pure, unadulterated fire from the man. Curving away late from middle stump and is so full Shehzad has to play for the line. So he looks to flick but this thunders into his off stump
length just outside off, stabbed into the covers on the front foot. 151kph
yorker curving away away towards off stump. Watson offers a full face and defends into the off side
overpitched just outside off, hurriedly driven to mid-off off the toe-end
short of a length at the pads, makes him hop off the pitch and deflect this towards short-fine off the thigh guard. He was pushing at it with one hand. 148kph and making him worry...
oh nicely put away. Full ball on the pads, leans in, uses the pace and closes the face at the perfect time to flick this through midwicket
length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops it on the pad
short and rising at the chest. He looks cramped because he's on the front foot, but the hands come through nicely and he drags this along the floor to the long leg boundary
length and in at leg stump, clipped to deep square off the inside half

that is so high in the air and just past the boundary! Was that a slower ball? 125kph from Hasan. An offcutter at a length on middle stump. He wants to use the pace and flick this behind square, but it ends up sailing high and just clearing the midwicket boundary. Not in control there
full control here! Short ball in the corridor, uses his forward press to spring up and swat this away, flat, over the midwicket boundary
length and in at middle stump, stays leg side of it and dabs it towards short third
short and wide and skidding across off stump. Beaten on the cut
slower ball, dropped short at leg stump. Drags it a touch but swivels to adjust. Gets it to the long leg boundary
short of a length and jumping across off stump, backs away and is beaten on the cut
beaten again. Just too quick for him right now. 148kph, length and fizzing across the corridor. Gets on the back foot and slashes. Should have probably been forward
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's left
length and in at leg stump. Uses the angle to flick to deep backward square
full and in at leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
shot! What a hit. Short of a length and skidding into him. But he backs away and slaps it off the back foot over the extra cover boundary! Serious strength to pull that off
full and into the pads, gets low and uses the angle to loft his sweep to the square leg boundary. No one back there

stunning! Just stunning from Watson right now. Dawson doesn't know where to bowl. Lobs this up at a length on off and Watto skips down before launching this straight over the bowler's head. Sixteen runs off three balls, no risk whatsoever. Superb
length on leg stump, jabbed to long-on off the back foot
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler. He dives but can only parry it to his left
length on middle stump, pushed into the midwicket region off the front foot
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, dabs it in front of mid-off with soft hands
bouncer has him ducking. That's a flashback. Gets steep at a middle stump line
length on middle stump, opens the face and defends to backward point
length on leg stump, clipped to deep square's right off the back foot
yorker length just outside off, stabbed out towards mid-off
gets it past mid-off. Length outside off, throws his hands at this, on the rise. Bat turns in the hands a touch, but there's enough to get it wide of the fielder
length outside off, driven on the rise to mid-off
length at leg stump, opens the face and dabs it to point
overpitched on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length at off stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
full offcutter on off stump, flicked to long-on
pulled away to the long leg boundary. That's poor bowling. Short and in at leg stump. Rocks back and gathers some easy runs
another pull! Very ordinary from Pollard. Put the square leg fielder back but is dispatched again. This is a slower ball, short and outside off. He crouches and gets this in front of square this time
short of a length on middle, pulled to deep square and that's a fifty for him. What a player
offcutter at a length on middle stump, flicked through square leg
Watson 1-0 Pollard. Length ball across him from off stump. Gets forward, opens the face and deftly runs it to short third's right
length and cramping him at the stumps. Pushed back towards the bowler
slashed past mid-off again. Length outside off, gets his weight into this and hammers it into the turf
length outside off, flicked to deep midwicket's right
yorker length on leg stump, looks to flick and gets it off the toe
short outside off, slashes and gets a thick outside edge that clears point

get out of the way umpire. Watson absolutely pummels this length ball straight back, but Pollard has done sensationally at long-on. Sprints to his left, lunges to his left and does a cartwheel as he grabs hold of this and keeps it to one. Unreal.
just evades deep square. It's off the bottom of the bat as he gets back to pull, but it clears the fielder to his left
short and in at off stump, backs away and cuts to point
inside edge into his body. Loses his footing as he makes room and looks to pull this again
short of a length outside off, looks to cut and is beaten
on the bounce to deep midwicket's right. Arm ball, back of a length. Gets the pull away but can't get it past Hasan
length outside off, slices harmlessly into the covers

pumps it over deep backward square. Time and again he manages to dig himself out when it looks he's been cramped. Short and at his ribs. He's on the front foot but the hands are so quick as he pulls and clears
low full toss outside off, a slower ball. Can't get the drive past mid-off
yorker outside leg stump. Deflected off the toe as he looks to flick
yorker wraps the toe again. Looks to flick but it's only a single at short fine. Nice bowling from Sameen
misses on the yorker and pays for it. It's overpitched at an off stump line. Backs away, gets low and scoops from underneath to clear the long-off boundary
length on leg stump, mistimed slog is dragged between long-on and deep midwicket
short of a length at middle stump, tapped back to the bowler
length outside off, opens the face and runs this straight to point off the front foot
length outside off, jabbed to extra cover's left on the rise
bouncer down leg side, has him evading yet again

tonks off stump! Wahab Riaz is unhittable tonight. Flings this in, rapid, at a length on middle stump. It slides away as Watson makes room to try and hit him over extra cover. Top of off is smashed and Wahab with the most smug expression as he's surrounded by his team-mates. Is it a bit late for Zalmi though? Watson's cracker innings has ended
full toss outside off, mistimed drive to mid-off
full on off stump, flicked with the angle to long-on's left

dropped! Leading edge as Ahsan Ali looks to flick a slower ball from outside off. Dawson runs backwards from point and is caught spinning as this slides between body and hands. Third man wasn't too far off. Was it his catch?
length outside off, punches to extra cover's left but his dive stops that. Saves three runs
outswinging yorker from around the wicket. Pakistan's no stranger to that ball, but Ahsan Ali certainly looks like he had no idea. Looks to flick again as this curves past the outside edge
overpitched outside off, throws the hands at it and gets it off the toe-end
length and in at leg stump, flicks aerially to deep square
flat and past deep backward square. Once again, incredible wrists from Ahsan. Length ball on leg stump and he picks it up, with the pace, and gets it over the line. 74 metres
short of a length outside off, opens the face and runs it to point

that's plumb unless he's got bat on it. He has a conversation with Rossouw and they don't take the review, so he's probably not got bat on it. Length ball at middle stump. Skids under his attempted flick and raps the knee flap of his back leg. That's hitting the middle of middle. Ahsan will no doubt keep his place in the next match though. Solid knock from him
slashes and can't get it off the middle. Length outside off, steps out and looks to carve this wide of mid-off. Can't manage it
short and wide outside off, cuts hard, gets it off the thick edge and clears point
short and wide and punished again. Lots of room and he chops it to third man's left
short and very wide outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, flicked to long-on's right
slower bouncer. Too short. Floats over his head

top edge and Pollard takes it himself. Offcutter at a length on off stump, gets down for the slog sweep and can't get it away. Pollard is far away from it but uses his reach in the end to grab it in the leg side
full and into the legs. Allows it to come on and clips to deep backward square's right
slower short ball, very wide outside off. Left alone
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Opens the face and nudges to short third's left
slower ball at  a length outisde off, gets forward and drives to mid-off's left
length outside off, poked into the covers on the front foot
overpitched on leg stump, flicked to deep square's right
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket's left on the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
short of a length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
ramps it to the third man boundary. Nicely done. Short ball in the corridor, backs away and reaches out to beat third man to his left
clears the infield and gets it over the long-off boundary, one bounce. Length outside off, ran down at it and used the room to slice it over
attempted yorker swings wildly past the marker outisde off
slower ball at a length on off stump, stays leg side and dabs it towards third man
length ball swings away late outside off, slashes and misses
length outside off, reaches out and pokes to point's right
full at middle stump, backs away and drills it to long-on's left
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Opens the face and runs it down to third man
off radar again. Slower ball, very wide outside off.
beaten. In the slot, but tails away late. Length and late swing past Sarfraz's attempted lofted drive
past the bat again, as it's too quick. About time they start targeting the boundaries behind the crease? This one skids under the slog in the corridor
wide of deep midwicket and into the boundary on the bounce. Stays still and uses the pace to lift this pull into the square leg boundary
taken at point. Low full toss tailing away from him. He gets into the leg side and has made too much room. Ends up slicing off the toe-end to the fielder
length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's left
smashed past the bowler and umpire. Short ball outside off, and he flat-bats it into the straight boundary. Almost a pull, that. Nicely timed
low full toss outside off, spreads his arms and chops at this. Gets it off the toe-end to sweeper cover
length outside off, looks to drill through cover, gets it to long-on off the inside half
short ball outside off, a slower one. Looks to hook and is beaten

holes out to deep midwicket. Slower ball, short of a length. Looks to pull on length, but is deceived by the pace. Dawson runs in a few yards and holds on with a reverse cup. The sting has been taken out of this innings
length at leg stump, flicked to deep square
full outside off, too fast for him to whip this into the leg side. Rolls out to mid-off off the toe-end
length outside off, guides to short third's right on the front foot
past off stump. Bravo was so late on this. A full toss curves away late to beat his swish and the stumps
yorker at off stump, jammed into the mid-off region
full and swinging in from outside off. Looks to drive and gets it back down the pitch off the inside half of the bat
slower short ball outside off, subdued pull, dragged out to long-on's left
low full toss on off stump, backs away and drills it to sweeper's right. Wahab fuming at the fielder who has stayed extremely square for this ball. Effect of the left-right combo?

whips this away! Stylish from Bravo to finish this innings. Full ball angled into him and he shuffles and gets the flick to the wide long-on boundary. Losing his length and that's four more to Wahab's figures
sends him over his head first ball. Length outside off, steps out and allows it to skid on before slamming it flat
inside edge onto leg, lobs off the boot but safely away from Sarfraz. This was on a length at off stump and he was looking for the slog sweep
short and wide and fast outside off. Left alone
short of a length and cutting away in the corridor. Squared up a touch as he pushes this to point

big lbw appeal is turned down. Kamran looks to run an arm ball down to third man. He's definitely got bat on this. Was there any pad? No! It's off the middle of the bat and there is absolutely no pad on this. Sarfraz was convinced and it was his call. It's a bad one
outside edge dribbles past short third man. Length outside off and turning away. Looks to drive without getting to the pitch and is safe, because there's no slip
full and in at the pads. Looks to flick, gets it off the inside edge
clears mid-on. Back of the hand slower ball at a length. A slight step out and then he lofts it off the inside half, on the up
short of a length outside off, jabbed out to third man
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
length outside off, steps out and drills it between cover and extra cover
slower ball floated up at yorker length outside off, chops it down to third man
length ball swinging in at off stump. Opens the face and runs it down to third man
length at middle stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot
length at off stump, gets deep in the crease and chips this to deep square's left off the back foot
length on off stump, defended to extra cover with soft hands
slapped over extra cover! Length ball outside off, steps out and keeps his shape as he launches this over the infield
bouncer at a middle stump line, arches back to let this pass
full slower ball at off stump, driven back at the bowler
full outside off, slices it to backward point on the front foot
slower ball at a length in the corridor. Swishes inside the line and is beaten
slower yorker outside off, looks to drive, can only chop it to cover
gets it past the bowler off the toe-end and mid-off barely puts in an effort to try and stop that. Gets past him and beats long-on to his left
slower ball at a length, down leg side. Can't get bat on the flick
slower full toss on middle stump, punched to long-on
falls short of extra cover. Short of a length ball at middle stump. Steps out and is cramped. Slices it into the off side
overpitched at middle stump, driven crisply out to long-on
slower ball at a length outside leg, guides the sweep straight to short fine
short and wide outside off, looks to pull, beaten
yorker just outside off, looks to dig it out, is beaten. That narrowly missed off stump
short of a length and into the body. Looks to poke into the off side, is cramped and this rolls back down the pitch
short of a length outside off, chops to third man's left
bouncer down leg side, left alone
slower ball outside off, backs away and looks to chop through point. Gets an under-edge to the keeper
length outside off, swivels and slogs at this. Beaten on the under-edge

length at off stump, opens the face and gets this to backward point's left. Umar Akmal there keeping the pressure on his brother. A dive to the left and throw at the non-striker's end. Arguably the run was still on, but they decide against it
connects and gets this over the midwicket boundary on the bounce. Short ball outside off, swings under it and gets connection on one at last

picks out deep square with a full toss! It's just been that kind of an evening for Kamran. Full toss on middle stump, flicks to Rossouw's right and he runs a few yards to his right and slides to hold on. Last ball of the Powerplay, Kamran leaves
short and turning into leg stump. Looks to pull, gets it to fine leg off the thigh
short and just outside off, barely moves as he cuts late to beat point
short of a length on middle stump, nudged into the leg side off the back foot
length on middle stump, steps out and punches to long-on
length and in at leg stump. Hurriedly pushed to midwicket
length at middle stump, steps out and bat-pads in front of middle stump as he looks to flick
googly at a length outside off, beats his late cut
slider dropped short outside off, gets deep in the crease and flat-bats it to long-off's left
length outside off, defended to point's left
length ball sliding down leg, past the flick
googly on leg stump, flicked to short fine
length outside off, steps out and carves to sweeper cover
length and skidding at leg stump. Poked through midwicket off the back foot
sliced back to the bowler. Beaten by the pace on the arm ball. Short of a length and skidding in at middle stump. Wants to pull but is late on that. Nawaz leaps high to his right and takes this
short of a length outside off, can't beat point with the cut
length on off stump, defended to extra cover on the back foot
arm ball climbing up in the corridor. Looks to cut and is beaten on the outside edge
length and fired down leg side. Looks to flick and gets this off the pad, past short fine
length at middle stump, hurriedly stabbed into the midwicket region
length on leg stump, flicked through square leg

that appears to have hit the bowler on the mouth. Length ball was smashed straight back at his face. He could only get one hand up in time but that has taken off a lot of pace. He's on his feet as a result. Immediately holds up his hands to let everyone know he's okay. But he can't say a word so there must be bruising inside his mouth. Walks off the field now along with the physio. That was a nervous moment. Imam got down the pitch and smoked this straight back at Fawad

and he'll complete Imam's innings too! Oh dear! Around the wicket with a quick, filthy straight ball short of a length and coming back at leg stump. Imam plays for the turn and gets back for the cut to lose his leg stump. Can't make this up!
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
full outside off, clears the front leg and drills it down to long-off
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length on off stump, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
short of a length outside off, shuffles, shows the stumps, steps out and at the end of it all can only push this to point for a single
length outside off, pushed to sweeper cover on the up
short outside off, backs away and mistimes a cut to point
length outside off, punched to sweeper's left
well bowled. Watches Misbah set up deep in the crease and tosses this up slow, at a length and wide outside off. Beats his slash

....and a wicket at long-on! Unbelievable. He folds his hands and looks around sheepishly. It's dropped halfway down the pitch and Dawson can only slice this pull shot straight to that fielder. This is the first time Ahsan has ever bowled in this format. What a night for what Kevin Pietersen would call pie-chuckers
short and turning away outside off. Stands tall and slaps it past the bowler to a straight long-off. Quite a normal field position for Pollard in this format
length ball sliding outside off, mistimed punch towards long-off
short ball gets up at stomach height on a middle stump line. Pokes it to long-on off the back foot
that's enough, says Misbah and sends Ahsan sailing over wide long-on. Length ball pushed through outside off and he gets down on one knee to absolutely cart this slog sweep
length ball outside off, spins past the wide marker but it's not given as Misbah had shuffled into the off side before leaving this
low full toss outside off, flicked to deep midwicket's right
length outside off, driven on the rise to long-off
low full toss outside off, driven to long-off

full at off stump, hurriedly jabbed between deep midwicket and long-on...and a mis up there gives four. Long-on had this covered with a slide to the right but deep midwicket slid across in front of him and parried this into the boundary
short of a length just outside off, dropped into the off side with soft hands
slower ball at a length outside off, gets back and clips towards long-on
short of a length skidding rapidly into the back thigh as he looks to push this into the leg side. It was off the inside edge
length on leg stump, dabbed through square leg off the back foot

pinned him on the back foot and this looks very out. Misbah won't dispute the decision. He's had two balls against Hasnain and has completely misread him both occasions to be beaten by pace. Length ball skidding and getting his back leg in front of off as he tries to hit this off the back foot. Should have been forward

straight into the box to welcome Sammy! Deceptive, this guy! Sammy also gets on the back foot to a length ball and is struck straight in the box. Onto the floor immediately and out sprints the team doctor. He's writhing, jumping around. That has stung.
length on middle stump but he's on the front foot this time. Flicked to midwicket
full and thudding into the front pas as Sammy looks to flick this
full ball and wide outside off, stretches his arms and spanks this to the wide long-off boundary
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
sooooo easy! Length ball on the pads, Sammy gets the front leg into the leg side and casually lifts this over deep square. No fuss.
short of a length on leg stump, pulled to deep midwicket
short outside off, too much room! Pollard accepts gratefully and clatters this between deep square and deep midwicket
full and down leg side, looks to flick and is beaten
slower ball at a length on leg stump, looks to flick and cops this on the thigh
beats long-off to his left. Full and tailing in at off stump, gets the front leg out of the way and crunches this with an open face
length at leg stump, slogged along the floor to deep midwicket

to long-on's right! This is a poor length from Bravo. Overpitched and in at leg stump. Pollard has set up deep in the crease and, despite mis-hitting this with a turning bat, has got enough to beat the fielder
slower ball, full toss on middle stump. Lines up for the swing but adjusts and taps to long-on

just over the long boundary! Length and into the pads - this isn't normal for Bravo. But picking them off is daily business for Darren Sammy. Uses the angle, uses the pace, whips it over short fine and eventually over the boundary padding

smokes it over the cover boundary! They can't, surely?! Sammy stays deep in the crease and carves this overpitched ball outside off. Bravo has completely lost his length there and this partnership has now given an almighty scare to Quetta. Wow.
length at off stump, leans in and flicks to deep midwicket
a misfield. Woeful from Tanvir. Length ball slanting in at leg stump. Looks to flick and gets it off the back leg. Trickles slowly to the fielder who takes his eyes off it and lets it pass
full and angled in at leg stump. Flicked to deep square's left

a sprint, a dive, a tumble and at the end of it all, Pollard picks up four after being completely deceived by the bowler. There is no justice sometimes. Length ball outside off, wants to drive through the line but ends up chipping it to Shehzad's left at long-off with one hand. Brilliant effort there but he's beaten by his own momentum
proper connection this time! Low full toss outside off, Pollard stands tall and just opens the face to get this drive to Shehzad's left at long-off. No chance this time, this is whistling past him

this is extremely ordinary cricket from Quetta. Length ball outside off, defended to short third man who misfields and allows a run. Then puts in a wild throw that gives them another run in the leg side. From there - another throw. This ends up at sweeper cover and they have half a chance to take three. They don't. Sarfraz asking his fielders to calm down.
length outside off, mistimed punch to long-off
length at off stump, opens the face and runs it to point
low full toss sliced over point and short third. Not in control, but there's no one behind there. But once again, poor bowling. Knee height full toss with a lot of width outside off
yorker length at leg stump, hurriedly jabbed to long-on
slower short ball coming in at the body. Looks to pull and cops it on the body
short of a length on off stump, cramped and can only pull along the floor to long-on
slower ball out of control. Very short and very wide. Left alone
lovely! A yorker at leg stump. Sammy swings, but this comes back down the pitch off the toe-end
skids under the bat! Slower ball, short of a length and skids through at knee height past off stump! He was looking to hit that at waist height
huuuuuuuuge! Oh Bravo, what have you done! Two top deliveries followed by an overpitched ball on leg stump. Sammy doesn't miss out on those. Pumps it 93 metres in the direction of long-on
beats him on the inside edge. Superb. Digs another slower ball into the pitch, short of a length, and that length is virtually unhittable. Cuts in past the pull shot and rises over middle stump

fool me twice! Sammy knows what's coming this time! A slower ball at a length and he waits for it in the crease. Waits and waits and waits and pummels this, all core strength, off the back foot and over long-on. Superb. Just superb.
low full toss on leg stump, sliced off the toe-end to extra cover
length and in at leg stump. Gets the front leg out of the way and heaves it to deep square off the inside half
sends him over midwicket! Length ball, not troubling Pollard with that pace. On his pads, swivels and sends it flying. His first six of the night

the top of middle stump! Oh Watson, you beauty! Sheepish grin, but has he done it for his team? Length ball on middle. Pollard loses his shape completely as he looks to slog this and his stumps are damaged

they've got Sammy! A length ball outside off, there to be hit, but Wahab is beaten on the swish. Sarfraz gather and underarms it onto the stumps as Sammy looks to plonk his bat in. He's well short. Viv Richards overjoyed on the touchline

mistimed and to long-off's left! That is it, surely? Short of a length outside off, slices it to that fielder's left. The throw comes back, and Sarfraz asks his local crowd to clap for his team. They've held on
full at off stump, mistimed drive to long-on
